alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 6:20PM MST until July 30 at 10:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 1030 PM MST. * At 620 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Phoenix, Mesa, Scottsdale, Tempe, Fountain Hills, Paradise Valley, Scottsdale Airport, Salt River Indian Community, Downtown Scottsdale, Camelback Mountain, Papago Park and Desert Ridge Marketplace. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 202 between mile markers 13 and 22. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 10 and 15...and near mile marker 9. AZ Route 101 between mile markers 29 and 38. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 177 and 186. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
